rComments: Prof Rival is a good music theory teacher. The contents of this course are tough, especially counterpoint, so it's ideal to make use of his office hours. He tends to come off a bit cold as another comment mentions, but he's perfectly approachable and helpful when you ask. Tough grader, but not unfair in my opinion.

He wasn't very clear in his grading methods and the lectures were unengaging, but other than that, the course wasn't complicated and the topics were very interesting. The ebook, online tutorials, and quizzes were extremely helpful. Always play your homework on a keyboard before handing it in. The more it makes sense melodically, the better.

This man is a tough marker but hes a very good teacher so if you listen and try your best to do all the work, you should be fine. He comes off as a little cold but he does care about students, and if anyone says that Rival hates them, theyre lying

Prof Rival is a clearly spoken professor who explains musical concepts VERY well for non-musicians to understand (for his intro to classical class). I didn't find his class hard at all, but that may be because I have a music background. Assignments were short and not very demanding, just make SURE to study the textbook and listenings for the exams.

this is the worst elective i have ever taken at uottawa. I have never come close to failing a course except this one. Makes it unbelieveably hard - when its supposed to be a bird course.  he had to bump the midterm by 15 pts in a fourth year class. HONESTLY AVOID IF YOU CAN..

Took this class as an elective to boost my GPA, do not do this. He's a nice prof but everyone was screwed over by the midterm exam, it was ridiculously difficult and instead of covering the main topics we discussed, focused a lot on irrelevant details found in the textbook. There is a concert review, CD review, midterm and final. don't recommend.
